title: Stefon Diggs reveals what heâ€™s trying to improve about himself after 11 years in the NFL
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Stefon Diggs aims to improve his attitude, acknowledging a tendency to get too critical of himself.
Diggs leads Patriots in several receiving categories, contributing to their six-game winning streak and QB Drake Maye's success.
Diggs attributes team improvement to coaches Josh McDaniels and Todd Downing's straightforward and supportive approach.

title: Commuter train plows through car on tracks in Acton
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: An MBTA commuter train hit an empty car on the tracks in Acton, causing no injuries.
The driver exited the car before the collision, which pushed the vehicle 300 feet; a citation will be issued.
The accident caused delays on the Fitchburg line; 44 train passengers were checked for injuries.

title: What to know about possible Red Sox free agent target Munetaka Murakami after posting
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Japanese star Munetaka Murakami has been posted by Tokyo Yakult Swallows for potential MLB free agency, with a deadline of Dec. 22.
Murakami, known as the "Japanese Babe Ruth," broke the NPB home run record with 56 homers in 2022 and has played mostly third base.
The Red Sox are considered possible suitors for Murakami with speculation suggesting an eight-year, $180 million deal may be offered.

title: Airlines are waiving fees, offering refunds due to reduced flight schedules
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Airlines are waiving fees and offering refunds due to a 10% FAA flight reduction at 40 airports, including Logan.
JetBlue, Southwest, United, American, Delta, and Spirit offer flexible rebooking and refund options for affected travelers.
Passengers advised to check with airlines for delays and cancellations due to the ongoing government shutdown.

title: After Cape Cod crash, readers say Mass. should tighten e-bike regulations
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: A Cape Cod crash involving an e-bike renewed debate over tighter regulations for electric bicycles in Massachusetts.
Lynne Forester, injured on Cape Cod Rail Trail, advocates for stricter e-bike rules to protect pedestrians.
78% of over 580 readers support stronger e-bike regulations, while 20% oppose additional regulations in Massachusetts.

title: Watch: Dog rescued from Ted Williams Tunnel
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts State Police rescued a dog from the Ted Williams Tunnel in Boston on Thursday morning.
A State Police trooper halted traffic to safely retrieve the dog from oncoming vehicles in the tunnel.
The dog was seen near the East Boston side before safely entering a police cruiser, per MassDOT.

title: Canterbury Farm, ‘a treasure to the Berkshires,’ closes after 40 years
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Canterbury Farm in Becket, Massachusetts, closed after 40 years, citing climate change and the rise of Airbnbs.
Linda and Dave Bacon, owners since 1985, created 22 km of trails and hosted cross-country skiers and lodgers.
Despite reduced ski seasons, the couple retired to focus on family and personal interests, staying in their renovated home.

title: Patriots will be without three key players for matchup vs. Buccaneers
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Rhamondre Stevenson, Kayshon Boutte, and Christian Elliss ruled out for Patriots game against Buccaneers due to injuries.
Boutte leads team with five touchdowns and 431 yards; his absence affects Patriots' receiving options.
Christian Elliss, second in team tackles, will be missed on defense against the NFC South leaders.

title: Is Drake Maye the MVP? Execs don’t think so, but several analysts do.
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Drake Maye has led the Patriots to a 7-2 start, ranking high in several quarterback metrics.
NFL executives gave Maye just one MVP vote, while Rams' Matthew Stafford received 13 votes.
Maye is third in MVP betting odds, behind Josh Allen and Patrick Mahomes, per DraftKings.

title: Who makes the best espresso martinis in Greater Boston?
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Boston.com seeks reader submissions for the best espresso martinis in Greater Boston.
Espresso martinis, popularized in the 1980s, have seen a revival in Boston's bar scene.
Readers can submit standard or creative espresso martini variations to Boston.com via a provided form or email.
